channel.title: [v0.1.3] RSPSDesigns - Webclient Maker - Open Sourced
channel.description:
Script has been updated, I have decided to have this script as an ongoing project so we will start with this update (v0.1.2).
I am still trying to comprehend MySQLi and more modern ways of communicating with MySQL databases, I am making progress but I do not want to include it in the script just yet as I am not 100% comfortable with what I do know. (Yes, still a programming newb, but I'm getting there!)
Change Log: (v0.1.3)
[code] - Redirects fixed. - "My Clients" function added. - Play Now link added to recent servers. - Some security enhancements. - $_SESSION changes. [/code]
[img]http://gyazo.com/e2ccb84d5826913e189377234fb94a98.png?1365894644[/img]
[url=http://rspsdesigns.com/forum/showthread.php?tid=39]Download + update log[/url]
Support for script:
As I release this script everywhere, it is really hard to keep up with support throughout the 3 main RSPS communities. I try my best to keep up with it but it's easier to do it on my support forums. Theres also many threads there with answers all ready posted. You can find more information on this in the scripts ACP.

item.title: [v0.1.3] RSPSDesigns - Webclient Maker - Open Sourced

RSCShadow:

Should post it on github or something so it’s easier to view changes.

I’ve been thinking about it, I want to get a few of the best RSPS web developers in on this so we can make this a very successful project.

item.title: [v0.1.3] RSPSDesigns - Webclient Maker - Open Sourced
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

Script has been updated, I have decided to have this script as an ongoing project so we will start with this update (v0.1).

I am still trying to comprehend MySQLi and more modern ways of communicating with MySQL databases, I am making progress but I do not want to include it in the script just yet as I am not 100% comfortable with what I do know. (Yes, still a programming newb, but I’m getting there!)

Change Log: (v0.1)

  • Added admin panel.
  • Updated style.
  • Added copyrights.
  • Modernized some parts of code.
  • Working active reports panel. (Reporting servers coming soon.)
  • Template system skeleton.
  • Removed useless codes/empty files.
  • Modernized CSS, less images, better page load.
  • Added installation wizard. (Thanks to Ruby for the code examples that I built this off of.)
  • Fixed path issues.
  • Commented out news system, uncomment for it to work, better one coming soon.
  • Security updates.
  • Removed lightbox, still remains in the files, initiate it if you have the knowledge.

Download for the script is still the same as in the first post, but for those of your who are too lazy to scroll, here you go.

Read full topic

item.title: [v0.1.3] RSPSDesigns - Webclient Maker - Open Sourced
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“vortex, post:18, topic:515942”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=634197.msg4283100#msg4283100 date=1365977410]

dadadada

Add onsubmit parameter to the form and put in “return validateForm()”, then make a JS function called validateForm() and put this in it:

function validateForm() { var emailStr = (document.forms["studentDetails"]["carerEmail"].value); if(emailStr.indexOf("@") == -1 || emailStr.indexOf(".") == -1 || emailStr.indexOf("@") != emailStr.lastIndexOf("@")) { alert("ERROR: A valid email address must contain a single '@' and at least one '.'."); return false; } }

(Taken directly from a project of mine, you’ll need to edit the field names)
[/quote]but you can’t bypass the server-side check[/quote]

So why not have both? check it client-sided to inform the user immediately (the return false will prevent submission) so that they don’t need to be redirected to another page, and then check it server-side incase they get past the client-sided check.

Read full topic

dadadada
[/quote]

Add onsubmit parameter to the form and put in “return validateForm()”, then make a JS function called validateForm() and put this in it:

function validateForm() { var emailStr = (document.forms["studentDetails"]["carerEmail"].value); if(emailStr.indexOf("@") == -1 || emailStr.indexOf(".") == -1 || emailStr.indexOf("@") != emailStr.lastIndexOf("@")) { alert("ERROR: A valid email address must contain a single '@' and at least one '.'."); return false; } }

(Taken directly from a project of mine, you’ll need to edit the field names)[/quote]but you can’t bypass the server-side check

Read full topic

item.title: [v0.1.3] RSPSDesigns - Webclient Maker - Open Sourced
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:7, topic:515942”]$username = stripslashes($_POST['username']); $password = stripslashes($_POST['password']); $username = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST['username']); $password = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST['password']);

Magic quotes enabled?

A note about using crypt() (yay Blowfish!): provide a salt to use for each password that is unique to the user instead of providing nothing. Also, note that if you have a PHP version >= 5.3.7 you should be using $2y$. A simple check for PHP version can allow you to use $2a$ for users with a lesser version.

Also, you might want to consider checking out filter_var() for validating email. Totally optional since you’re using regex but up to you. :)[/quote]

Add onsubmit parameter to the form and put in “return validateForm()”, then make a JS function called validateForm() and put this in it:

function validateForm() { var emailStr = (document.forms["studentDetails"]["carerEmail"].value); if(emailStr.indexOf("@") == -1 || emailStr.indexOf(".") == -1 || emailStr.indexOf("@") != emailStr.lastIndexOf("@")) { alert("ERROR: A valid email address must contain a single '@' and at least one '.'."); return false; } }

(Taken directly from a project of mine, you’ll need to edit the field names)

Read full topic

item.title: [v0.1.3] RSPSDesigns - Webclient Maker - Open Sourced
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

Ruby:

Deprecation is bad! All you have to do to avoid deprecated mysql_ functions is use mysqli_, it’s not difficult ;). Pretty much what justaguy said. In the form it looks like you’re using tables to style the page which as primarily a designer you should know is bad.

Oh yes, I know it’s bad. Was a bit lazy with the overall HTML.

Read full topic

item.title: [v0.1.3] RSPSDesigns - Webclient Maker - Open Sourced
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:7, topic:515942”]$username = stripslashes($_POST['username']); $password = stripslashes($_POST['password']); $username = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST['username']); $password = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST['password']);

Magic quotes enabled?

A note about using crypt() (yay Blowfish!): provide a salt to use for each password that is unique to the user instead of providing nothing. Also, note that if you have a PHP version >= 5.3.7 you should be using $2y$. A simple check for PHP version can allow you to use $2a$ for users with a lesser version.

Also, you might want to consider checking out filter_var() for validating email. Totally optional since you’re using regex but up to you. :)[/quote]

Your always willing to help! I will look into this!

Also, download link fixed.

Read full topic

item.title: [v0.1.3] RSPSDesigns - Webclient Maker - Open Sourced
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

$username = stripslashes($_POST['username']); $password = stripslashes($_POST['password']); $username = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST['username']); $password = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST['password']);

Magic quotes enabled?

A note about using crypt() (yay Blowfish!): provide a salt to use for each password that is unique to the user instead of providing nothing. Also, note that if you have a PHP version >= 5.3.7 you should be using $2y$. A simple check for PHP version can allow you to use $2a$ for users with a lesser version.

Also, you might want to consider checking out filter_var() for validating email. Totally optional since you’re using regex but up to you.

Read full topic

item.title: [v0.1.3] RSPSDesigns - Webclient Maker - Open Sourced
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

Ruby:

Mind posting the code?

It contains deprecated code, which I know you hate Ruby. :3

Register.php

[code]<?php
session_start();
$pageName = “Register”;
require_once ‘/assets/config/config.php’;
$errors = “”;
$username = “”;
$email = “”;
if(isset($_SESSION[‘loggedIn’])) {
header(“Location: ucp.php”);
}
if(isset($_POST[‘regSubmit’])) {
$username = stripslashes($_POST[‘username’]);
$password = stripslashes($_POST[‘password’]);
$username = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST[‘username’]);
$password = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST[‘password’]);
$password1 = $_POST[‘password1’];
$email = stripslashes($_POST[‘email’]);
$email = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST[‘email’]);
$email1 = $_POST[‘email1’];
$errors = “”;
$password1 = crypt($password1, ‘$2a$07$$’);
$password = crypt($password, ‘$2a$07$$’);
if(strlen($username) > 30) {
$errors .= “Sorry, your username must not be longer than 30 characters!
”;
}
if(strlen($username) < 5) {
$errors .= “Sorry, your username must be longer than 5 characters!
”;
}
if(empty($username)) {
$errors .= “Sorry, this field cannot be left empty! [Username]
”;
}
if(!preg_match(’/[a-z0-9]$/i’, $username)) {
$errors .= “Sorry, your username can only contain alpha-numeric characters!
”;
}
if(strlen($password) > 60) {
$errors .= “Sorry, your pasword cannot be longer than 50 characters.
”;
}
if(empty($password)) {
$errors .= “Sorry, this field cannot be left empty! [Password]
”;
}
if(strlen($password) < 8) {
$errors .= “Sorry, your password must be longer than 8 characters!
”;
}
if($password != $password1) {
$errors .= “Sorry, the passwords you entered do not match!
”;
}
if(empty($password1)) {
$errors .= “Sorry, this field cannot be left empty! [Confirm Password]
”;
}
if(!preg_match("/^[_a-z0-9-]+(.[_a-z0-9±]+)@[a-z0-9-]+(.[a-z0-9-]+)(.[a-z]{2,})$/i", $email)) {
$errors .= “Sorry, you didn’t enter a valid email!
”;
}
if($email != $email1) {
$errors .= “Sorry, the email addresses you entered do not match!
”;
}
if(empty($email)) {
$errors .= “Sorry, this field cannot be left empty! [E-Mail]
”;
}
if(empty($email1)) {
$errors .= “Sorry, this field cannot be left empty! [Confirm E-Mail]
”;
}
$query = mysql_query(“SELECT * FROM users WHERE username=’$username’”);
$count = mysql_num_rows($query);
if($count == 1) {
$errors .= “Sorry, this username is already taken!
”;
}
$query = mysql_query(“SELECT * FROM users WHERE email=’$email’”);
$count = mysql_num_rows($query);
if($count == 1) {
$errors .= “Sorry, this email is already taken!
”;
}
if(empty($errors) && $password === $password1 && $email === $email1) {
$query = “INSERT into users (username, password, email)values(’$username’, ‘$password’, ‘$email’)”;
$res = mysql_query($query);
header(“Location: login.php”);
}
mysql_close();
}
?>

<?php include '/assets/templates/overall/overallHead.php'; ?> <?php include '/assets/templates/navHead.php'; ?> <?php include '/assets/templates/loginBox.php'; ?> 
<div id="res_top">
	<h2>Hey there! Why don't you take a minute and register?</h2>
	<p>Registering for RuneClients has many advantages. You gain access to a members only control panel where you can create a webclient and gain points used to bring members to your server!
</div>
<div id="res_content">
	<span class="req"><?php echo $errors; ?></span>
	<table width="100%" cellspacing="0">
		<form action="register.php" method="post">
		<tr>
			<td width="20%"><strong>Username:</strong></td>
			<td width="50%"><input type="text" name="username" value="<?php echo $username ?>"/></td>
			<td width="30%">Username is used to login to the site!</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td width="20%"><strong>Password:</strong></td>
			<td width="50%"><input type="password" name="password" /></td>
			<td width="30%">Keep your password safe!</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td width="20%"><strong>Confirm Password:</strong></td>
			<td width="50%"><input type="password" name="password1" /></td>
			<td width="30%">Enter the same password as before!</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td width="20%"><strong>E-Mail:</strong></td>
			<td width="50%"><input type="text" name="email" value="<?php echo $email ?>" /></td>
			<td width="30%">Enter a valid E-Mail!</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td width="20%"><strong>Confirm E-Mail:</strong></td>
			<td width="50%"><input type="text" name="email1" /></td>
			<td width="30%">Enter the same E-Mail as before!</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td width="20%"><input type="submit" name="regSubmit" value="Register" /></td>
			<td width="50%">My clicking 'Register' you agree to our <a href="tos.php" title="Terms Of Service">Terms of Service</a>.</td>
			<td width="30%"></td>
		</tr>
		</form>
	</table>
</div>
<?php include '/assets/templates/overall/overallFoot.php'; ?>

[/code]

Screen.css

body {

	background: #0c0c0c;
	color: #fff;
	font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
	font-size: 13px;
}

.container {

	width: 1024px;
	height: auto;
	margin: 0 auto auto auto;
}

#header {

	height: auto;
	width: 1024px;
	margin: 0 auto auto auto;
}

.nav {

	height: 35px;
	width: auto;
	background: #171717;
	box-shadow: 0 0 5px #000;
	line-height: 33px;
}

.nav ul {

	margin: 0;
	padding: 0;
	list-style-type: none;
}

.nav li {

	display: inline;
	padding: 0;
	margin: 0;
}

.nav li a {

	padding: 11px 12px;
	color: #fff;
	font-size: 11px;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-decoration: none;
}

.nav li a.home {

	padding: 10px 12px;
	color: #333;
	font-size: 11px;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-decoration: none;
	background: #fff;
}

.nav li a:hover {

	padding: 10px 12px;
	color: #fff;
	font-size: 11px;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-decoration: none;
	background: #0088cc;
}

#jumbo {

	height: 300px;
	width: auto;
	background: #000 url(assets/images/large_bg.jpg) top no-repeat;
	border-radius: 5px;
	margin-top: 10px;
	text-align: center;
	padding: 20px;
	box-shadow: 0 0 10px #000;
}

#fixed_center {

	height: auto;
	width: auto;
	margin-top: 10px;
	text-shadow: 0 1px 5px #111;
}

.center_box_0 {

	height: auto;
	width: 310px;
	background: #3a3a3a url(assets/images/center_box.jpg);
	border: 1px solid #444;
	padding: 10px;
	float: left;
	box-shadow: 0 0 10px #000;
}

.center_box_1 {

	height: auto;
	width: 310px;
	background: #3a3a3a url(assets/images/center_box.jpg);
	border: 1px solid #444;
	padding: 10px;
	float: left;
	margin-left: 12px;
	box-shadow: 0 0 10px #000;
}

.center_box_2{

	height: auto;
	width: 310px;
	background: #3a3a3a url(assets/images/center_box.jpg);
	border: 1px solid #444;
	padding: 10px;
	float: left;
	margin-left: 12px;
	box-shadow: 0 0 10px #000;
}
/*Span Styles*/

span.mega {

	color: #e1e1e1;
	text-shadow: 0 0 10px #000;
	font-size: 100px;
}

span.miniMega {

	color: #e1e1e1;
	text-shadow: 0 0 10px #000;
	font-size: 25px;
	font-weight: normal;
}

/*Buttons */

a.btn_main {

	padding: 20px 200px;
	background: #0088cc;
	display: inline-block;
	margin-top: 30px;
	text-shadow: 0 1px 10px #00314b;
	color: #fff;
	font-size: 20px;
	text-decoration: none;
	border-radius: 3px;
	box-shadow: 0 0 10px #000;
}

a.center_btn {

	background: #e1e1e1;
	padding: 5px 15px;
	font-size: 11px;
	color: #222;
	font-weight: bold;
	display: inline-block;
	float: right;
	text-decoration: none;
	text-shadow: 0 1px 0 #fff;
	border-radius: 3px;
	box-shadow: 0 0 5px #111;
}
/*Span*/

span.req {

	color: #ff0000;
}

/*Headings, h1,h2,h3...*/

h2 {

	font-weight: normal;
	text-shadow: 0 1px 5px #111;
}

/*Tables*/

td {

	padding: 10px;
}

/*Forms*/

input.modal {

	width: 200px;
	height: 25px;
	border: 1px solid #ddd !important;
	background: #eee !important;
	color: #222 !important;
	border-radius: 4px;
}

input[type=submit] {

	padding: 9px 12px;
	background: #0088cc;
	text-shadow: 0 1px 10px #00314b;
	color: #fff;
	font-size: 11px;
	text-decoration: none;
	border-radius: 3px;
	border: none;
	font-weight: bold;
}

input[type=text], input[type=password] {

	border: 1px solid #111;
	background: #333;
	width: 200px;
	height: 20px;
	border-radius: 5px;
	padding: 5px;
	color: #fff;
	text-shadow: 0 0 5px #222;
}

textarea {

	border: 1px solid #111;
	background: #333;
	width: 400px;
	height: 120px;
	border-radius: 5px;
	padding: 5px;
	color: #fff;
	text-shadow: 0 0 5px #222;
	resize: none;
}

/*News Styles*/

#bottom_news {

	width: auto;
	height: auto;
	margin-top: 170px;
}

#newsCell {

	width: auto;
	height: auto;
	margin-top: 10px;
	box-shadow: 0 0 10px #000;
}

#newsTitle {

	background: #171717;
	border: 1px solid #000;
	height: 35px;
	line-height: 35px;
	padding-left: 10px;
	font-weight: bold;
}

#newsInfo {

	width: auto;
	height: auto;
	padding: 10px;
	border-left: 1px solid #000;
	border-right: 1px solid #000;
}

#newsBody {

	border-left: 1px solid #000;
	border-right: 1px solid #000;
	border-bottom: 1px solid #000;
	padding-left: 10px;
	padding-right: 10px;
	padding-bottom: 10px;
}

/*UCP Styles*/

#ucp_top {

	height: auto;
	width: auto;
	background: #3a3a3a url(assets/images/center_box.jpg);
	border: 1px solid #444;
	padding: 10px;
	box-shadow: 0 0 10px #000;
	margin-top: 10px;
	text-shadow: 0 1px 5px #111;
}

#ucp_content {

	height: auto;
	width: auto;
	background: #3a3a3a url(assets/images/texture_1.jpg);
	border: 1px solid #363636;
	padding: 10px;
	box-shadow: 0 0 10px #000;
	margin-top: 10px;
	text-shadow: 0 1px 5px #111;
}

/*Anchors*/

a { color: #aaa; text-decoration: none; font-weight: bold; }

/*RES Styles*/

#res_top {

	height: auto;
	width: auto;
	background: #3a3a3a url(assets/images/center_box.jpg);
	border: 1px solid #444;
	padding: 10px;
	box-shadow: 0 0 10px #000;
	margin-top: 10px;
	text-shadow: 0 1px 5px #111;
}

#res_content {

	height: auto;
	width: auto;
	background: #3a3a3a url(assets/images/texture_1.jpg);
	border: 1px solid #363636;
	padding: 10px;
	box-shadow: 0 0 10px #000;
	margin-top: 10px;
	text-shadow: 0 1px 5px #111;
}

#ucp_cell {

	width: 455px;
	height: 100px;
	background: #3a3a3a url(assets/images/center_box.jpg);
	border: 1px solid #444;
	text-shadow: 0 1px 5px #111;
	padding-left: 20px;
	line-height: 100px;
	font-size: 20px;
}

/*Search*/

#result {

	height: auto;
	padding: 10px;
	width: auto;
	background: #333;
	border: 1px solid #111;
	box-shadow: 0 0 10px #111;
}

/*Recent Servers*/

#cell {

	width: auto;
	height: 15px;
	padding: 10px;
	background: #333;
	border: 1px solid #111;
	box-shadow: 0 0 10px #111;
}
